text: How can you use a chip board to represent addition and subtraction of integers?

At this time, students should have informal methods for adding and subtracting integers using real world contexts and chip boards.

  • Students should know that the sum of two opposite numbers is zero (Additive Inverse Property a + (â€“a) = 0). In Chip Board Language: You can add any amount of black chips to the board as long as you add the same amount of red chips to the board. This will add a number and its opposite to the board which adds a value of 0.
  • Students should notice a connection between addition and subtraction with positive and negative numbers.
  • Students should have some informal understanding of strategies for adding and subtracting negative numbers.
